results.name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of 1/sqrt(1 - 2*x + (1+4*k)*x^2).
link: T. D. Noe, On the Divisibility of Generalized Central Trinomial Coefficients, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 9 (2006), Article 06.2.7.
formula: A(n,k) is the coefficient of x^n in the expansion of (1 + x - k*x^2)^n.
A(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..floor(n/2)} (-k)^j * binomial(n,j) * binomial(n-j,j) = Sum_{j=0..floor(n/2)} (-k)^j * binomial(n,2*j) * binomial(2*j,j).
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Sum[If[k == j == 0, 1, (-k)^j] * Binomial[n, j] * Binomial[n-j, j], {j, 0, Floor[n/2]}]; Table[T[k, n - k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Amiram Eldar_, May 13 2021 *)
